newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Foreigners eye new $4-5 bln Russian oil refinery.
newsitem.headline: Foreigners eye new $4-5 bln Russian oil refinery.

text.p: Foreign companies have held talks on building a new oil refinery in Russia's Far East next year or in 1999, the mayor of Vladivostok, Viktor Cherepkov, told the Echo Moscow radio station on Friday.

"He said that talks with foreign investors had already taken place," a statement from the radio station said. "(They) showed a great interest in the Vladivostok, Primorsky and Khabarovsky regions," he was quoted as saying, adding that the cost of the project would be around $4-5 billion.
Cherepkov gave no details on whether the ambitious project might actually get off the drawing board.
The Russian Far East has two oil refineries, one in Khabarovsk and one in Komsomolsk. Each processed around 34,000 barrels per day last year.
Russia's Far Eastern Sakhalin islands are home to a handful of multi-billion dollar production-sharing deals with Japanese and Western oil companies. The deals have yet to get fully off the ground.
